required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy and Safety of SeQuent® Please in the Treatment of Small Vessel Disease (SVD) Patient
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multicenter Study on the Efficacy and Safety of Paclitaxel-eluting PTCA-Balloon Catheter(SeQuent® Please) Compared to POBA in the Treatment of Small Vessel Disease (SVD) Patient

lead_sponsor.agency: B. Braun Medical International Trading Company Ltd.

clinical_study.source: B. Braun Medical International Trading Company Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of paclitaxel-releasing coronary balloon (Catheter SeQuent® Please) versus rapid exchange PTCA balloon catheter (SeQuent® Neo) in the treatment of stenoses of coronary small vessels. 270 subjects will be enrolled for the trials.

primary_outcome.measure: Late lumen loss in segment section at M9
primary_outcome.description: To measure the diameter loss in the in-segment late lumen loss (LLL) at 9 months after operation by using angiography

arm_group.arm_group_label: Rapid exchange PTCA Balloon Catheter (SeQuent® Neo)

intervention.description: SeQuent® Please in length of 10 mm, 15 mm, 17 mm, 20 mm, 26 mm, 30 mm and in diameter of 2.0 mm, 2.5mm, 2.75mm will be used in the trial.
SeQuent® Please in length of 10 mm, 15 mm, 17 mm, 20 mm, 26 mm, 30 mm and in diameter of 2.0 mm, 2.5mm, 2.75mm will be used in the trial.
intervention.arm_group_label: Rapid exchange PTCA Balloon Catheter (SeQuent® Neo)
